score.explanation: Your Wi-Fi network is performing adequately, but there are several areas for improvement to enhance stability and performance.
score.trend_summary: Since last scan: download improved, upload improved, ping worsened, networks increased.

latest_report.diagnosis: You are experiencing random dropouts possibly due to Wi-Fi congestion and interference from nearby networks. Optimization efforts can enhance your connectivity stability.

performance.interpretation: Your download speeds are close to your ISP plan maximum, while upload speeds are slightly below expectations. The ping rate is reasonable but can be improved.

problems: High network congestion on both 2.4GHz and 5GHz bands.
Potentially poor router placement affecting signal distribution.
fixes: Switch the 2.4GHz channel to 1 to reduce congestion from other networks using channel 11.
Change the 5GHz channel to 149 to minimize interference from overlapping networks on channel 36.
Consider relocating the router closer to the center of your home for improved coverage.
Enable Smart Connect if available to allow the router to automatically manage devices between bands efficiently.
Monitor connected devices and disconnect any that are not actively in use to allocate bandwidth better.
